text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 15th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
In the evening, when he returns from work, he takes the elevator to the 10th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining five floors to his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 15th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I need to figure out why this man takes the elevator all the way to the 15th floor on rainy days.
Let me start by understanding the problem step by step.
First, the man lives on the 15th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor (which is the 1st floor) to go to work.
In the evening, after work, he takes the elevator up to the 10th floor and then walks up the remaining five floors to his apartment.
But on rainy days, he changes his routine and takes the elevator all the way up to the 15th floor instead of getting off at the 10th and walking up.
I need to find out why this difference occurs on rainy days.
Maybe there's a practical reason, like something happening on rainy days that makes taking the elevator all the way more convenient or necessary.
Let me think about the elevator's behavior.
Typically, elevators go up and down, stopping at each floor.
But sometimes, especially in older buildings, the elevator might skip some floors when it's moving, especially during bad weather.
Maybe on rainy days, the elevator isn't running properly or is stuck, so it can't stop at the 10th floor.
If that's the case, he might not be able to get off at the 10th floor and would have to take the elevator all the way up to the 15th floor.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator's mechanism changes on rainy days.
For example, if it's raining, the elevator might malfunction, and he can't get off at the 10th floor.
So, to avoid getting stuck, he takes it all the way to his floor.
Another possibility is that on rainy days, the elevator's buttons don't work properly, so he can't press the 10th floor button.
This would force him to take the elevator to the 15th floor instead.
I also wonder if there's a safety issue.
Maybe on rainy days, the stairs are slippery, making it dangerous for him to walk up the stairs.
So, to avoid slipping, he takes the elevator all the way up.
However, the problem states that he walks up the stairs on non-rainy days, so maybe the stairs aren't usually a problem.
Unless on rainy days, the stairs get really wet and slippery, making walking unsafe.
But wait, the problem doesn't mention anything about the stairs being slippery, so maybe that's not the main reason.
It's more likely about the elevator's operation.
Perhaps on rainy days, the elevator doesn't stop at the 10th floor, so he has no choice but to go all the way up to the 15th floor.
Let me think about how elevators work.
They have buttons that correspond to each floor.
If the elevator is moving, it stops at each floor as it goes up or down.
But if the elevator is malfunctioning, it might skip certain floors.
For example, if the elevator is going up, it might stop at every floor, but if it's going down, it might not stop at certain floors, especially if it's broken.
Wait, but in the morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor, which is the 1st floor.
So the elevator goes from 15th to 1st floor every morning.
If the elevator is working normally, it stops at every floor on the way down.
In the evening, he goes from the ground floor to the 10th floor, then walks up five floors.
So, the elevator goes from 1st to 10th floor, then he walks up.
On rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way up to the 15th floor.
So, perhaps on rainy days, the elevator isn't stopping at the 10th floor in the evening, making it impossible for him to get off there.
Therefore, he has to take it all the way up to the 15th floor.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator is out of order on rainy days, so it can't stop at the 10th floor.
Therefore, he has to take it up to the 15th floor.
Another angle: maybe the man is in a hurry on rainy days and doesn't want to walk the stairs because it's taking too long, so he takes the elevator all the way.
But the problem says he walks up the stairs on non-rainy days, so maybe the stairs are quicker, but on rainy days, they're not.
But that seems less likely because usually, walking up stairs is quicker than waiting for the elevator, especially if the elevator is slow.
Wait, but the problem doesn't mention the speed of the elevator.
So, perhaps on rainy days, the elevator is faster, making it more efficient for him to take it all the way up instead of walking.
But I think the most plausible reason is related to the elevator's operation.
On rainy days, the elevator might not stop at the 10th floor, so he can't get off there.
Therefore, he takes it all the way up to the 15th floor.

So, to sum up, the man takes the elevator all the way up on rainy days because the elevator isn't stopping at the 10th floor, perhaps due to malfunction or poor weather affecting the elevator's operation.
Therefore, he has no choice but to take the elevator to the 15th floor.

</think>

The man takes the elevator all the way up to the 15th floor on rainy days because the elevator likely malfunctions or fails to stop at the 10th floor during inclement weather.
This forces him to go directly to his apartment, avoiding the need to walk up the stairs, which might be unsafe or inaccessible if the elevator is out of service or not stopping properly.
